name: signal-desktop-mcp
description: Access your Signal Desktop messages locally via MCP
long_description:
This MCP server enables Claude to read your Signal Desktop messages directly from your local database. It supports listing chats, retrieving messages with pagination, and searching within conversations. All data stays on your machine - no external API calls are made.

**Features:**
- List all Signal chats with message counts
- Retrieve messages from specific conversations
- Search for text within chats
- Full support for group chats and individual conversations

**Requirements:**
- Signal Desktop must be installed
- Close Signal Desktop before accessing messages (database lock)
- macOS, Windows, or Linux

source_dir.title: Signal Data Directory
source_dir.description: Path to Signal Desktop data directory. Leave empty to use the default location for your OS (recommended for most users).

key.title: Encryption Key
key.description: Database encryption key (hex format). Leave empty to auto-detect from Signal's config. Only needed if auto-detection fails.

tools.name: signal_list_chats
tools.description: List all Signal chats with contact names, phone numbers, and message counts

tools.name: signal_get_chat_messages
tools.description: Retrieve messages from a specific Signal chat with pagination support

tools.name: signal_search_chat
tools.description: Search for specific text within a Signal chat's messages

prompts.name: signal_summarize_chat
prompts.description: Summarize recent messages in a Signal chat
prompts.text: Please use the signal_get_chat_messages tool to retrieve recent messages from the Signal chat named '${arguments.chat_name}', then provide a concise summary of the conversation topics, key points, and any action items mentioned.

prompts.name: signal_chat_topics
prompts.description: Analyze discussion topics in a Signal chat
prompts.text: Please use the signal_get_chat_messages tool to retrieve messages from the Signal chat named '${arguments.chat_name}', then analyze and list the main topics that have been discussed.

prompts.name: signal_search_and_summarize
prompts.description: Search for a topic and summarize relevant messages
prompts.text: Please use the signal_search_chat tool to search for '${arguments.query}' in the Signal chat named '${arguments.chat_name}', then summarize the relevant messages and any conclusions or decisions that were made about this topic.
